column4: I wanted to install ubuntu, I downloaded the latest iso and burned it to a cd, but there wasn't a setup.exe in it?
did you make a dvd already?
do you seek to install it on a raw hard drive? or within windows
Will I lose my windows when I install ubuntu? isn't ubuntu a program-like-something?
it is an entire operating system. it can, however, be installed within windows on the latest versions -- and can be installed side-by-side with windows as normal
that depends on how you want to use it
I liked that cube style look, am I able to install just that feature?
compiz/beryl? as seen on youtube videos?

i have not used the ubuntu-within-windows method myself, but if you want to play games and all that jazz as seen in some of the videos..i'd go with a full install (assuming you're comfortable doing so)
doing a full install is as simple as rebooting with the dvd in your drive
it will guide you to installing it in a side-by-side form,
if you have two computers, i suggest that you use a 2nd one to ask questions during the install
